body_text:
This got bigger than I expected so I decided to land just the multiple notification support separately from adding new notifications to the app.
The animations leverage react-addons-css-transition-group now. I couldn't find a good way to mix React and the keyframe-based animations. I also had to use an explicit height for notifications that assumes one line because you can't transition a non-explicit height property.
The tests are a little different-looking than the tests around them, such as being grouped in describe blocks a little deeper, and using an async function instead of Promises directly. I think these will be a cleaner style for our tests, but I'm happy to make them match their surrounding code if ya'll don't agree.

title: Multiple notification support
body:
This got bigger than I expected so I decided to land just the multiple notification support separately from adding new notifications to the app.

The animations leverage `react-addons-css-transition-group` now. I couldn't find a good way to mix React and the keyframe-based animations. I also had to use an explicit height for notifications that assumes one line because you can't transition a non-explicit height property.

The tests are a little different-looking than the tests around them, such as being grouped in `describe` blocks a little deeper, and using an async function instead of Promises directly. I think these will be a cleaner style for our tests, but I'm happy to make them match their surrounding code if ya'll don't agree.
